channel.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
channel.description:
Should I change my producer name to “OP” instead of “Osharu Pérez”?!
[poll type=Single public=true] * Yes, because who the frick knows what “Osharu” even means? * Yes because OP is much shorter than “Osharu Pérez”... * No because OP is too much of a cliche... * No because “Osharu” means “Brave One” in the Osharunian language... * IDK, do what you want... [/poll]

item.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Osharu:

I’ll definitely stop making these threads asking for logo/names help, but I can’t promise anything for the next two days……

You’ve started at least three threads about your logo, at least one of which also dealt with your name. This one directly covers your name(s).

If you have more questions, maybe consider adding to one of your existing threads on the subject – i.e. this one.

If you keep creating new threads every time you unmake a decision, you risk wearing out the good will and interest of those you’re asking for help from.

Just a thought.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
akabillposters:

I don’t see any problem using Osharu Perez as an artist name.
It’s distinct, kinda exotic, kinda catchy and, imo, would certainly fit into the world of EDM producers.

Fwiw, I like Osharu Perez. Rolls off the tongue nicely.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]

item.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
(@TheRealJFalc wasn’t quite right in what I was getting at.)

I was just checking to see if your friends and family are legitimate/valuable sources of input for what is a personal creative endeavour.

My family aren’t as none of them would enjoy listening to the kinds of music I make. And, the only friends whose opinion I tend to seek regarding my music are those who would enjoy the kind of music I make or who work in the industry.

Even then, I rarely ask, as the right answer needs to feel right to me, not a committee of other people.

I might sometimes seek input to break an internal stalemate, e.g. when I have multiple options that I’m stuck choosing between. But I won’t let the opinions of others make the final decision.

 
Fwiw…

I don’t see any problem using Osharu Perez as an artist name.
It’s distinct, kinda exotic, kinda catchy and, imo, would certainly fit into the world of EDM producers.

I don’t think you need to keep trying to ‘logo-fy / band-ify’ it. You’re not really making it any better by doing that.

Stand by the name. It’s not too long, as some have said.
It’s certainly within the bounds of what audiences will accept and learn. It’s certainly not a barrier to success.

Just look at the Billboard Dance 100 to see how many successful dance music artists use ‘real names’.

Billboard

Billboard Dance 100 Artists of 2018: The Complete List

Here are the top 100 dance and electronic music artists in the world -- based on charts statistics, touring data and a fan-voted poll.

Heck, look at the mainstream charts. No shortage of ‘real names’ there.

 
Either way, pick something, make a decision - soon - so you don’t need to keep making new threads every week asking about your name or logo.

Now, just go out there, make great music and make the name unforgettable.

Read full topic

item.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Osharu:

My dad used to work in the music industry, and now he does construction . My family listens to my music as genuine fans of it! What are you trying to say?

I think he is trying to say that if your name is indeed connected to the music industry, then it would be best not to change it. A case could be made that Miley Cyrus got her road to fame from her father, Billy Ray Cyrus.

Read full topic

Look, to add to this, imma reiterate something that I’ve said on this forum before: there is a professional band called the Butthole Surfers. Think about that for a second. People pay actual money to see a band called Butthole Surfers play music. It’s not really the name that matters, it’s the music.

item.source: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]

item.title: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
This has come up before, and I’ll echo what was previously said cause I think it was good advice.

If you’re going to rebrand, be sure you don’t already have big audience, be sure to pick something meaningful to you and also to pick something that is easy to pronounce (within reason).

It’s not a great idea to ask someone else what you should be called. It’s like having someone pick your clothes in the morning. It’s a decision you (and everyone) should make because it should be meaningful to you.

Or you could just call yourself Steve

Quick Edit: The audience part is only mentioned because you could potentially alienate those who already know you as one name. At the end of the day though, your music and your sound will distinctly be you, it can just cause confusion.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I change my producer name? [POLL]
